reviews.text: This small hotel is right in the middle of Geneva so the location is great for getting out and walking around. It seems small from the street as basically a doorway but is large inside with a dark but nicely decorated lobby.
reviews.title: Right in the middle of Geneva

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I asked for a quiet room and was then allocated a different one then first assigned. The room was quiet, spacious and very comfortable. The bathroom was recently renovated and very nice.
reviews.title: Hotel does not care about its customers. Promises much, but provides little

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room service was fast and efficent with the food being average. It was interesting to work on my laptop on a tiny antique table in the corner, but it is a hotel in Europe so not unexpected.
reviews.title: nine out of ten

reviews.text: We arrived in Geneva driving to be told that yes they did have parking but it was all booked out and we should have called 2 days prior to book a space. At no point were we told this when we booked.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel and Location Would go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were told to go find a space in a parade. We were given wrong directions and could not find anywhere to park. We returned to the hotel. They were not interested in our problem and other guests came in too frustrated at being unable to find parking. The hotel staff were very unhelpful simply telling us to keep driving around until we found soemwhere or our car would be towed away. In the end we had to leave and try and find another hotel as we could not find parking anywhere. Everywhere was booked in Geneva so we had to drive 2 hours to find a place.
reviews.title: Small luxury hotel near the Lake of Geneva

reviews.text: The food both in terms of room service and restaurant are incredibly limited it has to be the shortest menu I've ever seen in my life. So if you'll for food I'd go outside and there are a small number of good restaurants within a 10 min walk. There is a good french bistro about a minute away from the back entrance of the hotel through a small parade of shops.

Hotel Rotary, Geneva
reviews.text: Nice small boutique hotel, delicious breakfast, excellent service and a perfect location near the lake. Value for the money.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: nice hotel close to centre

reviews.text: This hotel isn't too prepossessing from the outside as it is tucked between shops. But once inside, it feels very old world. The room are slightly eccentric in decor, but it was the most comfortable bed -- and the best pillows -- we had come across in Europe. The room was quiet, the area quiet enough to sleep with the windows open, and the adjoining suite for the kids was perfect. The breakfast is great, service good. The only criticism I would have is that the front desk sent us to fairly touristy restaurants. We kept walking until we reached the part of town where people actually live, and found several good - and much more affordable - restaurants.
reviews.title: Too expensive for what they provide

reviews.text: I can see why this hotel is no longer a Sofitel -- it is run down and tired. Rooms are dowdy, the public areas are OK but old, and the service is not at all accommodating. I am an A-Club Platinum and the upgrade benefits were not honored (even after I asked). One of our two rooms smelled really bad, and when I asked if they could convert 20 euros to Swiss francs at the front desk on a Sunday morning, they flat-out refused and told me that all the banks would be closed as well. I would not stay here again, even at a low rate.
reviews.title: Run down and tired, lackluster service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we arrived, we didn't know how far away the hotel was from the airport so we decided to take a taxi...only to find out it was a short walk away! Hotel is beautiful- you can tell it's been around for awhile, but def. well-kept.
reviews.title: Classy and elegant, great location. would def. stay again..

reviews.text: Our room was absolutely perfect-couldn't have asked for anything more. Spacious, clean, well-appointed and had everything you can expect from a 4-star hotel. Staff were helpful and even gave us a special discount card for transportation. All in all, an excellent stay and I wouldn't hesitate to come again.
reviews.title: A fine Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here on the way back from Zermatt for one night before our flight back to Los Angeles. It is well located within easy walking distance to the main train station and all shops/restaurants. The staff was very welcoming. The rooms were large for european standards and the baths were very nice. The hotel had a old charm to it. Nothing over the top fancy...just comfortable, classy and clean. I would stay again. The dining in the hotel was limited but restaurants are all around you! We walked to the river and across...very easy.
reviews.title: Excellent value
